definition: lit. slap the table and shout with praise (idiom); fig. wonderful!/amazing!/great!
to pat/to clap/to slap/to swat/to take (a photo)/to shoot (a film)/racket (sports)/beat (music)
(legal) case/incident/record/file/table
to shout/to call/to order/to ask/to be called/by (indicates agent in the passive mood)
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means

sentences.english: His skill level was simply astounding .
sentences.chinese: 他的技術水平令人拍案叫絕。

sentences.english: It may have been my greatest "Wow! "moment in all of sports.
sentences.chinese: 那是我一切體育觀看經歷當中，最爲拍案叫絕的時刻。

sentences.english: Amazingly enough, your phone rings in area 215.
sentences.chinese: 拍案叫絕不夠，你的電話鈴聲面積215。

sentences.english: Their set designs are always stunning.
sentences.chinese: 他們的佈景設計經常讓人拍案叫絕。

sentences.english: "Hoisting ring's king" rookie player Chen Yibing has demonstrated brilliant performance which made me clap the table.
sentences.chinese: “吊環王”小將陳一冰的精彩表現令我拍案叫絕。

sentences.english: Of course, made me this lovely is published.
sentences.chinese: 當然，更讓我拍案叫絕的是出版這件事。

sentences.english: We were overwhelmed with admiration for the superb performance.
sentences.chinese: 精彩的表演令人拍案叫絕。

definition: (to gasp) with admiration
to be full of admiration
to click one's tongue in wonder (idiom)/to be astonished
out of the ordinary
the eye cannot take it all in (idiom); too many good things to see/a feast for the eyes
(idiom) to gasp in amazement/to acclaim as the peak of perfection
to envy/to admire
gifted or skillful writing
(idiom) impossible to fault/impeccable
to have a unique style of one's own (idiom)
lit. seamless heavenly clothes (idiom)/fig. flawless
numerous and confused/in a mess
living spirit, living image (idiom); true to life/vivid and realistic
lit. the stove fire has turned bright green (allusion to Daoist alchemy) (idiom)/fig. (of an art, a technique etc) brought to the point of perfection
lit. not a common chord (idiom); outstanding/brilliant/out of the common run
more than one can attend to (idiom)/deluged (with inquiries etc)/overwhelmed (by the beauty of the scenery)
